og.Description: The New Mexico Court of Appeals recently ruled that the statutory exclusion of farm and ranch laborers from coverage under the New Mexico Workers' Compensation Act (WCA) is unconstitutional. The appeals court ordered that laborers working on ranches or farms with three or more employees must be granted coverage for their workplace injuries.
og.Title: New Mexico court: Farmers eligible for workers' comp, too

article_metadata.description: Latest HR News - Human resources News on Workers' Compensation
